tool_description:
Lingvanex works via HTTPS requests. The URL of all requests starts with https://api-b2b.backenster.com/b1/api/v3/. In case of a protocol selection error and using HTTP, the request will be redirected to the address with the HTTPS protocol (status code 302).

Authentication of requests is done by adding the “Authorization” header with the following data format: Bearer The key can be created on the user control panel page https://lingvanex.com/account
name: Lingvanex Translate
title: Lingvanex Translate

api_list.name: /getLanguages

required_parameters.name: code
required_parameters.description: the language code in the format “language code_code of the country”, which is used to display the names of the languages. The language code is represented only in lowercase letters, the country code only in uppercase letters (example en_GB, es_ES, ru_RU etc). If this option is not present, then English is used by default

err.description: the text of the error. It is null if the response status is 200. Otherwise, it contains a string

codeName.description: the language name translated using the language specified by the query parameter “code”

code_alpha_1.description: the language code in the “language code” format

flagPath.description: the relative address of which is the image of the country flag. Example static/flags/afrikaans. The full address for downloading the flag will be https://backenster.com/v2/static/flags/afrikaans.png. In order to download flags in increased resolutions, you should add to this parameter: @2x or @3x (example https://backenster.com/v2/static/flags/afrikaans@2x.png or  https://backenster.com/v2/static/flags/afrikaans@3x.png)

full_code.description: the language code in the format “language code_code of the country”

modes.description: an array of objects, each of which is a description of the function that is supported in the given language

genders.description: logical value true or false, which shows the ability to synthesize speech for both sexes. Displayed only for function “Speech synthesis“

name.description: name of the function. Currently, only 4 functions are widely supported: “Speech synthesis“, “Image recognition“, “Translation“, “Speech recognition“

value.description: logical value true or false, which shows the status of the function: on or off

testWordForSyntezis.description: a word for testing a speech synthesizer
